snippet: The ban could take up to three years to take effect, but the decision is welcomed by environmental advocates who say the demand for shark fins has endangered shark populations worldwide.
abstract: China will prohibit official banquets from serving shark fin soup, an expensive and popular delicacy blamed for a sharp decline in global shark populations; ban could take as many as three years to take effect, and it remains to be seen how closely it will be observed across the sprawling nation.
lead_paragraph: The ban could take up to three years to take effect, but the decision is welcomed by environmental advocates who say the demand for shark fins has endangered shark populations worldwide.

headline.seo: China Says No More Shark Fin Soup at State Banquets
headline.main: China Says No More Shark Fin Soup at State Banquets
headline.print_headline: China to Ban Shark Fin Soup At State Events
